pageContext.claim: “I heard in New York today that Governor Cuomo wants to try and simplify the ballots because he thinks they're too complicated. And all of that, I agree with him. I think that's good. But you don't do that now. The ballots are starting to come in. And, you know, you can't do it now. It's too late.”
pageContext.analysis: Cuomo did make a change to New York’s voting practices on Sept. 26, but it did not have to do with the ballots. Cuomo’s legislation “expedited party enrollment changes to make it easier for voters to participate in the upcoming primary elections.”
